speaker: Narrator
text: Early 1990s. A normal college morning.

speaker: Narrator
text: You're just another student. Friendly enough, but never really involved. Content to drift through life unnoticed.

speaker: Narrator
text: The walk to campus is quiet. Peaceful, even. Until...

speaker: Narrator
text: BOOM!

speaker: Student
text: What the hell was that?!

speaker: Narrator
text: Students ahead of you gasp and start running in the opposite direction. The smart thing would be to run with them.

speaker: Narrator
text: But curiosity gets the better of you. What could have caused that explosion?

speaker: Narrator
text: You move toward the sound, and find... a hole. A massive crater in the middle of the street.

speaker: Protagonist
text: A sinkhole? But sinkholes don't explode...

speaker: Narrator
text: You lean closer to look inside. That's when you see movement in the darkness.

speaker: Narrator
text: A hand shoots out and grabs your wrist!

speaker: Protagonist
text: WHAT THE--

speaker: Narrator
text: You're pulled through. The world inverts. Colors you've never seen. Sounds that don't belong.

speaker: Narrator
text: And then you're standing in... somewhere else. Definitely not Earth.

speaker: Kara
text: Why are you just standing there?! MOVE!

speaker: Narrator
text: The voice belongs to the hand that grabbed you. A towering woman with greenish skin, muscles like steel cables, and eyes full of panic.

speaker: Protagonist
text: W-what? Where am I? Who are you?!

speaker: Kara
text: Questions later! Run NOW!

speaker: Narrator
text: That's when you feel it. A presence. Wrong. Hungry. Ancient.

speaker: Narrator
text: A massive shadow falls over both of you. You can't see it clearly - your mind refuses to process what it's seeing.

speaker: Kara
text: No! Not again! There's too many of them!

speaker: Narrator
text: Panic overwhelms you. Every instinct screaming. Your hand shoots forward, palm out, like you're trying to push it away.

speaker: Narrator
text: The world goes WHITE.

speaker: Narrator
text: You wake up on asphalt. Earth. The familiar smell of car exhaust and morning dew.

speaker: Kara
text: You... you're awake. What did you DO?

speaker: Narrator
text: The orc woman is standing over you, staring in disbelief. Behind her, the hole is covered by a shimmering white barrier.

speaker: Narrator
text: Inside the barrier, shapes writhe and slam against it. The THINGS. Trapped.

speaker: Kara
text: In three hundred years... no one has ever stopped them. And you just... you just sealed them away.

speaker: Protagonist
text: I... what? I don't understand any of this!

speaker: Kara
text: Neither do I. But you just changed everything.

speaker: Narrator
text: The barrier held. No one expected it to, but it did. And in those three years, everything changed.

speaker: Narrator
text: More humans discovered they had abilities. The THINGS could be fought. Defeated. For the first time in history, there was hope.

speaker: Narrator
text: Other species came through from different worlds. Not all were hostile. Many sought refuge from the THINGS that had devoured their homes.

speaker: Narrator
text: The barrier only stopped the hostile entities. Explorers began venturing into the other worlds, bringing back strange artifacts, magical items, wonders beyond imagination.

speaker: Narrator
text: A new economy emerged. Dungeon runners. People who made their living diving into other worlds and returning with treasures.

speaker: Narrator
text: And that's where you find yourself now. At the Crossroads Inn, base of operations for dungeon runners.

speaker: Narrator
text: Ready to make your fortune in the worlds beyond.
